basics.name: Joe Pasquale
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Graduating from UMass Amherst in May 2021 with a B.S. in Computer Science and Economics. Currently slated to begin working for a financial technology firm called Advisor360 out of Weston, MA as a Software Engineer. Brother of Kappa Sigma Fraternity, Gamma-Delta Chapter. Following what brings me joy.

work.summary: Starting my first professional developer experience as a Software Engineer for Advisor360

Worked as an IT intern at a local manufacturing company during the COVID pandemic (hence the short timeframe). While at Tech Etch, I put together a Flask application that allowed users to query the company's SQL database, which had been migrated from a Paradox DOS DBMS.
Assisted in migration of grant proposals and awards from Smartgrant Management System to Kuali Management System

projects.title: Microservice Web App Template
projects.description: A template for a microservice based web app. Contains nginx for routing and load balancing, React applet on port 3000, as well as a flask applet on port 5000.

projects.title: LinkUp
projects.description: A group scheduler application that allows for democratic time management systems combined with effective scheduling algorithms to efficiently help groups of people plan schedules around their lives. Simply have endpoint users add their availibility into the system and LinkUp is able to choose effective time slots and suggest locations they can meet.

projects.title: EleNa
projects.description: Elevation Based Navigation Software. An application for iOS written in Swift that shows user elevation change along routed paths.

projects.title: SQL Query Tool
projects.description: A web application to query a local MSSQL server

projects.title: Shelf
projects.description: Shelf is a website which allows a user to sign up and store books that they are currently reading, have read, or plan to read. They can search for books which are fetched from the Google Books API, which will return basic information about the book, such as title, author, and publisher, as well as more detailed information, such as cover art and Google Books rating. Users are able to add reviews and ratings to books. Users can share their 'shelves' with other people when they add them as a friend, and they can comment on activity from members of their friends list, which show up in a feed. This was done with Daniel Coley and Josh Vasilevsky, my two other team members in COMPSCI 326 at UMass.

projects.title: React!
projects.description: A reaction minigame I made as part of the interview process for Tech Etch. A word with a color will flash on the screen, and you must click the correct color in the appropriate amount of time.

projects.title: Old Website
projects.description: What my website used to be like before I refactored everything from GitHub Pages.

projects.title: URecycle
projects.description: An app to help incentivize recycling on UMass Campus. Made with a team of 7 others for CS 325
